sub_topic: Finding the volume of a sphere inscribed in a cube.
message_1: A cube has a side length of 6 cm. Find the volume of a sphere inscribed in the cube.
message_2:
To find the volume of a sphere inscribed in a cube, we first need to find the diameter of the sphere, which is equal to the side length of the cube. In this case, the side length of the cube is 6 cm, so the diameter of the sphere is also 6 cm.

The radius of the sphere is half of the diameter, so the radius is 3 cm.

The formula for the volume of a sphere is V = (4/3)πr^3, where V is the volume and r is the radius.

Substitute the radius (3 cm) into the formula:

V = (4/3)π(3)^3

V = (4/3)π(27)

V = (4)(9)π

V = 36π cubic centimeters

So, the volume of the sphere inscribed in the cube is 36π cubic centimeters.
